author: karalabe
content:
I've published a small benchmark suite based on my EVM fractal generator stuff. I really don't know how to add other clients and I'm unsure I would find the time to figure it out, but PRs are welcome; ideally via some docker method so I don't have to build 6 different ecosystems.

https://github.com/karalabe/burntpix-benchmark

author: karalabe
content: Even if nobody wants to be listed, the code is very math and compute heavy, so it might be an interesting thing to profile and see if there are some low hanging fruits to optimise in one client or another

author: karalabe
content:
Thought about this over lunch and I removed all notions of client comparisons. Everyone is welcome to use the code as a stress test for their own client to optimise, but I don't want to start a measuring contest.

Keeping it positive rather: enjoy the pics while tuning your code.

author: timbeiko
content:
**ACDE tomorrow 14:00 UTC**
Agenda: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/939
Stream: https://youtube.com/live/FhMBatolkOM
Zoom will be shared here right before the call.

author: timbeiko
content:
A few notes about tomorrow's call:
- First, great work everyone on triaging and fixing the issues found on Goerli yesterday ðŸ™Œ ! The current set dates for Sepolia (Jan 30) & Holesky (Feb 7) assume that we put out client releases and an announcement by mid next week. **If, due to how Goerli went yesterday, teams feel like this is too soon, we absolutely need to decide on tomorrow's call. ** Regardless, as <@583892532644151312> pointed out, we should at least get the 4788 contracts deployed on Sepolia and Holesky (maybe we want to wait for mainnet?). 
- Second, we're planning to review the various Prague/Electra proposals, so please have a look at the thread before the call (https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/prague-electra-network-upgrade-meta-thread/16809). Shoutout to <@&1070471163219824730> for writing up their views ahead of time: https://www.paradigm.xyz/2024/01/ethereum-2024 !
- Third, on the next ACDE (Feb 1), we'd like to do a deep dive into Verkle, given how big it is. It would be useful for the Verkle folks if tomorrow we could aggregate questions/topics/etc. that people would like to cover, so that they can prepare accordingly. 

See you tomorrow!

author: foobar0x
content:
Wrote up a summary of why we should ship either 3074 or 5806 in next hardfork: https://0xfoobar.substack.com/p/batch-transactions-for-eoas

TLDR:
- stale approvals are a huge security risk, have already drained 100s of millions from retail. EOA batch txs fix this
- batch txs are a 'free lunch' for state growth, by removing unnecessary overhead of sequential txs can fit more actions into same state size
- batch txs eliminate unbundling risk and make the private relaying world more competitive
- EOAs are >90% of current addresses, should continue improving the default experience while working on more complex smart contract wallets
